text: {{Infobox officeholder | name = Barry Gardiner | honorific-suffix = MP | image = Official portrait of Barry Gardiner MP crop 2, 2024.jpg | caption = Official portrait, 2024 | office2 = Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Biodiversity, Landscape and Rural Affairs | primeminister2 = Tony Blair | predecessor2 = Jim Knight | successor2 = Jonathan Shaw | term_start2 = 5 May 2006 | term_end2 = 28 June 2007 | office3 = Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Delivery and Efficiency | primeminister3 = Tony Blair | predecessor3 = Nigel Griffiths | successor3 = Office abolished | term_start3 = 10 May 2005 | term_end3 = 5 May 2006 | office4 = Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Northern Ireland | primeminister4 = Tony Blair | term_start4 = 2 April 2004 | term_end4 = 10 May 2005 | predecessor4 = Jane Kennedy | successor4 = Jeff Rooker | office9 = Member of Parliament for Brent West Brent North (1997-2024) | term_start9 = 1 May 1997 | term_end9 = | predecessor9 = Rhodes Boyson | successor9 = | majority9 = 3,793 (9.2%) | birth_name = Barry Strachan Gardiner | birth_date = | birth_place = Glasgow, Scotland | death_date = | death_place = | party = Labour | spouse = | children = 4 | alma_mater = | website = }} Barry Strachan Gardiner (born 10 March 1957) is a British Labour Party politician. He is the Shadow Secretary of State for International Trade since 2016. He has been a Member of Parliament (MP) for Brent North from 1997 to 2024, then for Brent West since 2024. Gardiner worked under Tony Blair and Gordon Brown as a junior minister in the Northern Ireland Office, the Department for Productivity, Energy and Industry, the Department of Trade and Industry and finally in the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Politicians from Glasgow Category:British socialists Category:Living people Category:Harvard University alumni Category:UK MPs 1997–2001 Category:UK MPs 2001–2005 Category:UK MPs 2005–2010 Category:UK MPs 2010–2015 Category:UK MPs 2015–2017 Category:UK MPs 2017–2019 Category:UK MPs 2019–2024
